content: The growth in the first half was even better, with a 55% year-over-year increase, totaling BRL402 million in revenues. The gross margin for Q2 stood at almost 38%, a solid increase of 5 percentage points from Q2 2021, while for the first half the gross margin was 35.8%, up 5.6 percentage points from the year before. While the CPaaS business still generates 71% of our revenues, over half of our gross profit is already coming from SaaS, which actually makes us a SaaS company. For 2022, this business is expected to reach around BRL600 million in revenues, with a gross margin of approximately 23%, generated by almost 9,000 clients. This combination of solid organic growth with M&A positively impacted our adjusted gross margin, which went up almost 6 percentage points to reach 35.8% in the first half. For the second half of the year, we expect to continue to focus on integrating our M&As and improving profitability, as we add a full six months of Movidesk gross margins into our numbers. But again, as of now itâs important for us to emphasize that while we continue to see total revenue growth still at about 50% a year, we decided that that we need to focus on profitability and generating cash flow rather than simply growing. There was a reason, for instance, if you look our reported EBITDA of minus â for the first half of minus BRL22 million versus the BRL9 million that we say, itâs the underlying recurring EBITDA for the first half that has to do with the fact that we need to do adjustments in the year now. If you're delivering a bit more higher here and you expect to start the growth faster yet, that's all true, but we have a revenue mix between first half of the year and second half in CPaaS due to natural seasonality.
